words.definition: To appreciate something is to be able to see its value.
words.example: I can appreciate the lovely scenery.

words.definition: If something is available, it means you can get it.
words.example: There were many seats available in the room.

words.definition: To beat someone means to do better than they do.
words.example: I managed to beat everyone in the race.

words.definition: If something is bright, it shows a lot of light.
words.example: The bright light from the sun made me close my eyes.

words.definition: To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special.
words.example: We all celebrated when we heard the great news.

words.definition: To determine means to choose or make a decision.
words.example: He tried to determine which one to eat first.

words.definition: To disappear means to go away or not be seen.
words.example: The ship disappeared behind the big hill.

words.definition: If you talk about something else, you talk about something different.
words.example: I wanted a bike for my birthday, but I got something else.

words.definition: Fair describes treating someone in a way that is right or reasonable.
words.example: He sold me his car for a fair price.

words.definition: To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction.
words.example: The water flowed over the rocks and into the lake.

words.definition: If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you.
words.example: When he can’t find his way, he takes every step forward carefully.

words.definition: A hill is a round area of land that is higher than the land around it.
words.example: The sun was rising above the green hills.

words.definition: A level is a point on a scale that measures something.
words.example: Please check the level of the water in the tank.

words.definition: A lone person or thing is the only one of that kind.
words.example: A lone man walked along the street.

words.definition: A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground.
words.example: When the ice melted, it formed a puddle.

words.definition: A response is the answer to a question.
words.example: He asked if I was coming, but my response was “no.”

words.definition: A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall or winter.
words.example: Fall is a warm season, while winter is very cold.

words.definition: A solution is a way to solve a problem.
words.example: There are many problems, but only one solution.

words.definition: To waste means to use something carelessly and unnecessarily.
words.example: Turn off the water so you don't waste it.

words.definition: You use whether when you must choose between two things.
words.example: I couldn’t decide whether to go left or right.
